sentence.Network_en: Bucket : ( n . ) a big handhold that is easy to hold on to.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个很容易抓住的大手点.

sentence.Network_en: He got a firm handhold on a rough jerkin.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一把抓住了那人的短上衣.

sentence.Network_en: The climber scrabble about widely for a handhold.
sentence.Network_cn: 爬山人四处摸着搭手之处.

entry.def: A handhold is a small hole or hollow in something such as rock or a wall that you can put your hand in if you are trying to climb it.

example.ex: I found handholds and hoisted myself along.
example.tran: 我找到手可以抓的地方往上爬。

auth_sentence.content: Foundations, primarily, in one's art; yet it also grants the critic a handhold in the assessment of new sounds.
auth_sentence.res_content: Foundations, primarily, in one's art; yet it also grants the critic a handhold in the assessment of new sounds.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Foundations, primarily, in one's art; yet it also grants the critic a handhold in the assessment of new sounds.

auth_sentence.content: In my rain-filled boots, I edged out along the windward side, double-checking every foothold and handhold before relying on it.
auth_sentence.res_content: In my rain-filled boots, I edged out along the windward side, double-checking every foothold and handhold before relying on it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In my rain-filled boots, I edged out along the windward side, double-checking every foothold and handhold before relying on it.

auth_sentence.content: I saw the ledge we'd decided on as an exit point, but I couldn't find a handhold.
